alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Crockett County through 515 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Ft Lancaster, or 18 miles east of Sheffield. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ft Lancaster, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290 and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 337 and 354. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
